title: 2430 - Study Up On This Impressive Vocabulary
description:
Take our 2 - minute quiz to discover your exact English fluency level and get a personalized study plan → https://cf.allearsenglish.com/fluency-quiz

Subscribe to this channel: https://rb.gy/pqu4sa 

Part of leading a vibrant life is continuing to learn, but not all study terms can be used for everyone- today get four ways to talk about learning and studying in English.

Listen and Subscribe to All Ears English:
Apple Podcasts: https://rb.gy/mdot2s
Spotify: https://rb.gy/vatkvb
Google Podcasts: https://rb.gy/cjehuh
_________________________________________________________ 

Follow All Ears English on social media: 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/all_ears_english/?hl=en
Website: https://www.allearsenglish.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/allearsenglish/
Email: support@allearsenglish.com 

About All Ears English:
Are you feeling stuck with your English? Many people study English but don’t actually learn it. We created a better way to learn English to help you move from stuck to fearless to fluent in English. Throw away your boring old textbook! You should feel inspired when you learn English. We believe the purpose of learning English is to connect with people. Don’t get stuck in perfection by focusing on your mistakes. Come hang out with Lindsay, Michelle, Jessica and Aubrey! We are here to help you relax, have fun, and learn real, natural English. #ielts #learnenglish #englishvocabulary #listeningskills #listeningpractice #listeningcomprehension #englishlearning

transcript.text: Hey there Aubrey.
How's it going today?
I am.
Excellent.
Lindsay, I have a question for you.
transcript.translation: 林赛，我有个问题想问你。

transcript.text: Sure.
Have you read up on anything interesting lately?
transcript.translation: 你最近读到什么有趣的东西了吗？

transcript.text: That's a good question because my first thought is I, you know, I started a new book,
transcript.translation: 这是个好问题，因为我首先想到的是，你知道，我开始读一本新书，

transcript.text: but that doesn't really answer the question you're asking me.
transcript.translation: 但这并没有真正回答你问我的问题。

transcript.text: Have you read up on anything and Yeah.
So this couldn't be like reading a novel, right?
transcript.translation: 所以这不像是读小说，对吧？

transcript.text: No, no.
It doesn't really answer the question.
transcript.translation: 这并没有真正回答问题。

transcript.text: So yeah, I'm always reading up on the news, Aubrey keeping, keeping up to date on what's happening.
transcript.translation: 所以是的，我一直在关注新闻，奥布里，随时了解最新动态。

transcript.text: Okay, nice.
Perfect.
I started reading, I know there's this kind of trendy popular theory.
transcript.translation: 我开始阅读，我知道有一种时髦的流行理论。

keyword.explanation: 意思是时尚的，流行的，通常指某个时期内非常受追捧的事物。带有'赶时髦'的意味

usages.en: That new restaurant is very trendy right now.
usages.zh: 那家新餐厅现在很时髦

transcript.text: Mel Robbins wrote this book, the Let Them Theory and my brother was really excited about it.
transcript.translation: 梅尔·罗宾斯写了这本书，《让他们理论》，我哥哥对此非常兴奋。

keyword.explanation: 一种心理学理论，主张不去试图改变或控制他人，而是让他们做自己想做的事

usages.en: I've been reading up on the Let Them Theory.
usages.zh: 我一直在研究《让他们理论》

transcript.text: So I started reading up on that theory and sort of anything related.
transcript.translation: 所以我开始研究这个理论以及与之相关的内容。

transcript.text: So yeah, I've been reading up on the Let Them Theory.
transcript.translation: 是的，我一直在研究《让他们理论》。

transcript.text: Interesting.
Had you heard of it, Lindsay?
Interesting.
I've heard of it, but I don't know what it is.
transcript.translation: 我听说过，但不知道具体是什么。

transcript.text: Real quick.
What is it sort of of just like instead of trying to change people's minds or control, just let them, right.
transcript.translation: 它是什么？就是与其试图改变别人的想法或控制他们，不如让他们做自己想做的，对吧。

transcript.text: Whatever they're gonna do.
Yeah, let them do it.
Don't let it affect your attitude or your happiness.
transcript.translation: 不要让这影响你的态度或快乐。

transcript.text: Right.
But it definitely goes into it more because you know, sometimes you, and there's also like, let me, okay, okay, I'll let you.
transcript.translation: 但它肯定更深入，因为你知道，有时候你，还有像是，让我，好吧，好吧，我会让你。

transcript.text: But also I need to let me do things that will help me reach my goals righting.
transcript.translation: 但我也需要让我做一些能帮助我实现目标的事情，对吧。

transcript.text: Got it.
All right.
Interesting.
I'll have to check.
I'll have to read up on that.
Aubrey, I'll have to read up.
There you go.
Something to read up on.
This is interesting.
This phrase came up.
We had a great question and we're sharing some related phrases.
transcript.translation: 我们有一个很棒的问题，并且我们在分享一些相关的短语。

transcript.text: Do you wanna read the today's question for us?
transcript.translation: 你想为我们读一下今天的问题吗？

transcript.text: Yes.
This question came in from Yge Kirk K and Yge says the other day, while I was talking to a friend from the US I mentioned that I had to study a lot that night and didn't have much time.
transcript.translation: 这个问题来自Yge Kirk K，Yge说前几天，当我和一个来自美国的朋友聊天时，我提到那天晚上我必须学习很多，没有太多时间。

transcript.text: She replied, so you'll hit the books, which I find quite funny and interesting.
transcript.translation: 她回答说，所以你会'hit the books'，我觉得这很有趣。

keyword.explanation: 俚语，意思是努力学习或复习功课，通常用于学生准备考试时

usages.en: I need to hit the books for my exam tomorrow.
usages.zh: 我得为明天的考试努力学习

transcript.text: It's a phrase I hadn't heard before.
transcript.translation: 这是一个我之前没听过的短语。

transcript.text: That's why I thought this might be an idea for your podcast.
transcript.translation: 这就是为什么我觉得这可能适合你们的播客。

transcript.text: By the way, I recently discovered your podcast and I really enjoy listening to it.
transcript.translation: 顺便说一下，我最近发现了你们的播客，我真的很喜欢听。

transcript.text: Oh, that's great to know, Aubrey, isn't it?
transcript.translation: 哦，很高兴知道，奥布里，不是吗？

transcript.text: Yes.
Awesome.
And I can totally see why this would seem like a really funny expression, right?
transcript.translation: 我完全理解为什么这会看起来像一个非常有趣的表达，对吧？

transcript.text: 'cause usually a hit is like a punch or maybe you hit something with your car.
transcript.translation: 因为通常'hit'像是打一拳，或者你可能用车撞到什么东西。

transcript.text: So it seems weird that there's this idiom hit the book.
transcript.translation: 所以看起来很奇怪，有这样一个习语'hit the book'。

transcript.text: So you imagine someone literally, yeah, hitting a book.
transcript.translation: 所以你想象有人真的，是的，打一本书。

transcript.text: It does seem that's not what it means.
transcript.translation: 看起来确实不是这个意思。

transcript.text: Totally agree.
It's very strange.
It's totally counterintuitive.
And we'll get into it today.
But first guys, go ahead and hit this follow button.
transcript.translation: 但首先，大家，去点击这个关注按钮。

transcript.text: Hit that follow button.
If you just found the show, maybe your friend recommended it to you.
transcript.translation: 如果你刚刚发现这个节目，可能是你的朋友推荐给你的。

transcript.text: Make sure you're following the show so you get new episodes five days a week.
transcript.translation: 确保你关注了这个节目，这样你每周五天都能收到新剧集。

transcript.text: Okay.
And I see what you did there.
transcript.translation: 我明白你刚才做了什么。

transcript.text: Hit the follow button, like you hit the books.
transcript.translation: 'hit the follow button'，就像你'hit the books'。

transcript.text: It's funny, I often use hit when we don't really mean to hit anything.
transcript.translation: 有趣的是，我经常用'hit'，但我们并不是真的要打什么。

transcript.text: Very interesting.
Good stuff.
So yeah, let's talk about this phrase.
transcript.translation: 所以是的，让我们谈谈这个短语。

transcript.text: Aubrey hit the books.
Yeah.
What does it mean first?
Yeah, it means studying.
It's very specific to schoolwork, right?
transcript.translation: 它非常特定于学校作业，对吧？

transcript.text: If you are in classes, college, high school, and you have to study for an exam, you would say, I'm gonna hit the books.
transcript.translation: 如果你在上课，大学，高中，你必须为考试学习，你会说，我要'hit the books'。

transcript.text: If you're studying for the bar, right?
transcript.translation: 如果你在为律师资格考试学习，对吧？

transcript.text: For big exams, all that type of test, that's when we would say, I'm gonna hit the books.
transcript.translation: 对于大考，所有那种类型的考试，那时我们会说，我要'hit the books'。

transcript.text: If you just need to study a lot.
transcript.translation: 如果你只需要学习很多。

transcript.text: Yeah.
Okay, good stuff.
I need to hit the books.
I have an exam tomorrow, for example.
Or again, he can't come to dinner.
transcript.translation: 或者再说一次，他不能来吃晚饭。

transcript.text: He's hitting the books tonight.
Yeah, but what's interesting, yeah, he is not literally hitting a book.
transcript.translation: 是的，但有趣的是，是的，他并不是真的在打一本书。

transcript.text: It means he is studying.
It's a funny way to say it.
transcript.translation: 这是一种有趣的表达方式。

transcript.text: It's a very idiomatic.
Exactly.
But it's interesting to think about, you know, would you ever say this about work?
transcript.translation: 但有趣的是，你知道，你会用这个短语来形容工作吗？

transcript.text: Maybe if you had to read a lot of manuals or read some instructions, would you say, I'm gonna hit the books?
transcript.translation: 也许如果你必须阅读很多手册或一些说明，你会说，我要'hit the books'吗？

transcript.text: It's a good question.
You really wouldn't, this is especially reserved for being a student in school.
transcript.translation: 你真的不会，这特别保留给在学校的学生。

transcript.text: Even if you are professional and you do study things, you, it's just, it just means you're in school.
transcript.translation: 即使你是专业人士并且你确实在学习东西，你，它只是意味着你在上学。

transcript.text: Hit the books.
Exactly.
Yeah.
So where I said, have you read up on anything lately?
transcript.translation: 所以我之前问，你最近有阅读什么吗？

transcript.text: That's because I know you're not in school.
transcript.translation: 那是因为我知道你没在上学。

transcript.text: If I knew you were registered, you know, if you were doing a PhD, I might say, I might say, have you been hitting the books lately?
transcript.translation: 如果我知道你注册了，比如在读博士，我可能会问，你最近在努力学习吗？

keyword.explanation: 俚语，意思是努力学习，通常指为了考试或学业而刻苦读书

usages.en: I need to hit the books this weekend for my final exams.
usages.zh: 这周末我得为期末考试努力学习。

transcript.text: But where I know you're not, I would say, or have you been reading up on anything?
transcript.translation: 但既然我知道你没有，我会问，你最近有在阅读什么吗？

transcript.text: 'cause we still study.
We still research.
Yes.
When we're not enrolled in school, but we don't hit the books.
transcript.translation: 当我们没有注册学校时，但我们不会说‘hitting the books’。

transcript.text: Very interesting.
Yeah.
I mean, I'm taking an online course on Coursera right now.
transcript.translation: 我是说，我现在正在Coursera上参加一门在线课程。

keyword.explanation: 一个提供在线课程的平台，通常与大学合作提供各种学科的课程

usages.en: I'm taking a machine learning course on Coursera.
usages.zh: 我正在Coursera上学习一门机器学习课程。

transcript.text: Multiple ones about ai.

keyword.explanation: 人工智能（Artificial Intelligence）的缩写，指模拟人类智能的机器系统

usages.zh: 人工智能正在改变许多行业。

transcript.text: You know how to prompt ai, how to do it, and that.
transcript.translation: 你知道如何提示AI，如何操作之类的。

keyword.explanation: 在AI领域，指输入给AI模型的指令或问题，以获取特定输出

usages.en: You need to learn how to prompt AI effectively.
usages.zh: 你需要学习如何有效地提示AI。

transcript.text: I still wouldn't say I'm hitting the books when it comes to ai.
transcript.translation: 但我仍然不会说我在‘hitting the books’学习AI。

transcript.text: No, it doesn't work, Aubrey.
It's a very narrow phrase, right?
transcript.translation: 这是一个非常狭窄的短语，对吧？

transcript.text: You're reading up on it.

keyword.explanation: 意思是阅读大量关于某个主题的内容，通常是为了了解或研究

usages.en: I've been reading up on climate change recently.
usages.zh: 我最近一直在阅读关于气候变化的内容。

transcript.text: That might be perfect for our next phrase here.
transcript.translation: 这可能非常适合我们下一个短语。

transcript.text: We say study up on, study up on.
transcript.translation: 我们说‘study up on’，‘study up on’。

keyword.explanation: 意思是深入研究或学习某个主题，比‘reading up on’更广泛

usages.en: I need to study up on this topic before the meeting.
usages.zh: 我需要在会议前深入研究这个主题。

transcript.text: This is more flexible.
This means we're studying or researching anything.
transcript.translation: 这意味着我们在学习或研究任何东西。

transcript.text: So you are studying up on ai.
Yeah.
For example, here are some sample sentences.
I don't know much about that.
transcript.translation: 我对那位政治家的观点不太了解。

transcript.text: Politician's views.
I need to study up on it.
Yeah.
transcript.translation: 所以你可能会在大选前这样做。

transcript.text: So you might do this before a big election.
transcript.translation: 如果你平时不太关注，你需要‘study up on’这些观点。

transcript.text: If you're not really tuned in all the time, you need to study up on views.
transcript.translation: 或者她一直在‘studying up on’情商。

transcript.text: Or she's been studying up on emotional intelligence.
transcript.translation: 我一直在‘studying up on’‘Let them’理论。

transcript.text: I've been studying up on the Let them theory.
Right?
transcript.translation: 所以这个，你不需要正式注册任何学校。

transcript.text: So this, you don't have to be officially enrolled in any schooling.
transcript.translation: 任何你在研究或学习的东西，你都可以用这个。

transcript.text: Anything you're researching or studying about, you could use this.
Yes, I love it.
transcript.translation: 然后我们继续‘read up on’，Hari，‘study up on’和‘read up on’有什么区别？

transcript.text: And then we move on to read up on now Hari, what is the difference between study up on and read up on?
transcript.translation: 是的，它们可以非常同义，对吧？

transcript.text: Yeah, these can be pretty synonymous, right?
Yeah.
transcript.translation: 你可以说你在‘reading up on’AI。

transcript.text: If you, you could say you're reading up on ai.
transcript.translation: 如果你在阅读很多相关内容，阅读文章，如果你在阅读新闻，对吧？

transcript.text: If you are reading a lot about it, reading articles, if you're reading the news, right?
transcript.translation: 这个，‘study up on’更多用于你真正在研究、深入、试图学习的东西。

transcript.text: This, if you study up on is more for something you're really researching, diving into, trying to study about.
transcript.translation: 而‘read up on’只是意味着你在阅读很多相关内容，范围更窄。

transcript.text: Whereas read up on just means you're reading a lot about, it's a little more narrow.
Right?
transcript.translation: 也许‘study up on’是总称，你可以是‘reading up on’它，但你也可以，我不知道，做测验之类的。

transcript.text: Maybe the umbrella term is study up on which you could be reading up on it, but you also could be, I don't know, taking quizzes or something.
Exactly.
Right.
transcript.translation: 而如果你只是在阅读很多相关内容，那么你不会说‘study up on’，只是‘reading up on’它。

transcript.text: Whereas if you're just reading a lot about it, then you wouldn't say study up on just reading it.
Reading up on it.
transcript.translation: 例如，她一直在‘reading up on’情商，对吧？

transcript.text: For example, she's been reading up on emotional intelligence, right?
Same thing.
transcript.translation: 这只是意味着她可能在阅读很多文章。

transcript.text: This just means maybe she's reading a lot of articles.
Oh.
transcript.translation: 这里我们有一个AI的例子。

transcript.text: And here we have an AI example.
Love it.
Nice.
I need to read up on ai.
transcript.translation: 我觉得有很多我不知道的东西。

transcript.text: I feel like there's a lot I don't know about it.
Right?
Yeah.
transcript.translation: 所以这些可以非常互换，非常同义。

transcript.text: So these are pretty interchangeable, pretty synonymous.
transcript.translation: 任何你在阅读、学习、可能在网上研究的东西。

transcript.text: Just anything You're reading a lot about studying, about researching online maybe.
Yeah.
And I like the next one.
transcript.translation: Aubrey，你以前会临时抱佛脚吗？

keyword.explanation: 俚语，意思是临时抱佛脚，通常指在考试前突击学习

usages.en: I had to cram all night for the chemistry exam.
usages.zh: 我不得不为化学考试通宵突击学习。

transcript.text: Aubrey, did you use to cram for tests?
Yes, absolutely.
I was really bad at procrastinating.
transcript.translation: 然后在考试前一晚，我会通宵临时抱佛脚。

transcript.text: And then the night before an exam, I'd be up all night long cramming.
Yeah, it's so, it's so bad.
transcript.translation: 这是高中生的常见习惯，对吧？

transcript.text: It's a common habit of high school kids, right?
transcript.translation: 他们在学期中不专心，然后在考试前一晚，我们得把所有东西塞进脑子里，考完后就全忘了。

transcript.text: They don't pay attention during the semester and then the night before, we have to jam everything in our brains and then we let it all out after we take the test.
Exactly right.
transcript.translation: 这只是意味着一次性学习很多，通常是在拖延之后。

transcript.text: This just means to study a lot at once, usually after procrastinating.
But this is a little more flexible, right?
transcript.translation: ‘Hitting the books’只是关于学校学习。

transcript.text: Hitting the books is just about like schooling.
transcript.translation: 如果你在工作中需要做一个演讲而你拖延了，你可以说，我今晚得临时抱佛脚。

transcript.text: If you also are supposed to give a presentation at work and you procrastinate it, then you could say, I'm gonna have to cram tonight.
transcript.translation: 在我写这些幻灯片之前有很多东西要学。

transcript.text: There's a lot I have to learn before I write these slides.
transcript.translation: 例如，你在最后一分钟做的事情。

transcript.text: For example, something you're doing last minute.
transcript.translation: 我认为这很重要，因为临时抱佛脚只是关于把信息塞进脑子里。

transcript.text: I think it's important though, because cramming is just, is about the act of getting information into your brain.
transcript.translation: 所以如果你为了把信息塞进脑子里然后展示它而临时抱佛脚，那是可以的。

transcript.text: So if you're cramming to get the info in your brain to then present it, that works.
transcript.translation: 但如果你完全正确，只是在赶演讲，那会是另一个动词，对吧，Aubrey？

transcript.text: But if you're exactly right, just hustling on the presentation, that would be another verb, right, Aubrey?
Right.
transcript.translation: 但如果你在创建幻灯片之前有很多东西要读。

transcript.text: But this, if you, if there's a bunch you have to read before you create the slides.
Yes.
transcript.translation: 你可以，你可以在最后一分钟临时抱佛脚。

transcript.text: There's a, you could, you could cram last minute for that.
Yeah.
Yep, yep.
transcript.translation: 知道这个区别真的很重要。

transcript.text: Really important to know that difference there.
Good.
transcript.translation: 我们会稍作休息，然后回来。

transcript.text: We'll take a quick break and then we'll be back.
Alright.
Aubrey, role play time here
transcript.translation: 在这个角色扮演中我们是同学。

transcript.text: We are classmates in this role play.
Okay.
Alright.
You wanna start us out?
transcript.translation: 今晚我们几个人在自习室‘hitting the books’，如果你想来的话。

transcript.text: A few of us are hitting the books at a study session tonight if you want to come.
Oh, thanks.
transcript.translation: 我可能会接受你的邀请。

keyword.explanation: 意思是接受某人的提议或邀请

usages.en: Thanks for the offer, I'll take you up on that.
usages.zh: 谢谢你的提议，我会接受的。

transcript.text: I might take you up on that.
transcript.translation: 我得抓紧时间临时抱佛脚了。

keyword.explanation: 指考试前突击学习，临时抱佛脚。通常带有时间紧迫、高强度学习的含义。

usages.en: I stayed up all night cramming for the final exam.
usages.zh: 我通宵熬夜为期末考试临时抱佛脚

transcript.text: I've got some serious cramming to do.
What are you writing your thesis on?
Gender identity.
transcript.translation: 我一直在研究性别如何影响人的自我认知。

transcript.text: I've been studying up on how much one's gender affects their sense of self.
Interesting.
transcript.translation: 这绝对是我想要深入了解的话题。

keyword.explanation: 指通过阅读深入了解某个主题，比普通阅读更系统全面。

usages.en: I need to read up on blockchain technology before the meeting.
usages.zh: 开会前我需要深入了解区块链技术

transcript.text: There's definitely something that's definitely something I'd like to read up on.
transcript.translation: 你论文写完能给我看看吗？

transcript.text: Can I read your paper when it's finished?
Absolutely.
Nice, nice, nice.
transcript.translation: 所以我特意把我们安排成学生身份，这样用'埋头苦读'才合适。

keyword.explanation: 俚语，指刻苦学习，尤其指学生为考试或作业用功读书。

usages.en: No party tonight, I'll be hitting the books for midterms.
usages.zh: 今晚不聚会，我要为期中考试埋头苦读

transcript.text: So I definitely had to make us students here so that we could use hitting the books.
Oh, yep.
Exa.
And that proves it.
Right?
transcript.translation: 除非你是某个课程项目的学生，否则不能用这个表达。

transcript.text: It just doesn't apply unless you're a student in a, in a program.
Exactly.
transcript.translation: 你开场时说我们几个今晚要开学习会埋头苦读。

transcript.text: So you started us out by saying a few of us are hitting the books at a study session tonight.
transcript.translation: 所以你邀请我的意思就是我们要一起学习。

transcript.text: So you were inviting me just meaning we're going to study together.
transcript.translation: 然后我说谢谢，可能会接受邀请。

transcript.text: And then you said thanks, I might take you up on that.
transcript.translation: 我得抓紧时间临时抱佛脚了。

transcript.text: I've got some serious cramming to do.
transcript.translation: 就是你需要把这些信息都塞进脑子里。

transcript.text: So you need to jam all this information into your head.
Exactly.
I'm probably have been procrastinating.
transcript.translation: 我不是那种...我很好，我准备好了。

transcript.text: I'm not like, I'm good, I'm ready.
I've been studying.
No, I've got some cramming to do.
Oh my God.
transcript.translation: Aubrey，你以前考试前会紧张吗？

transcript.text: Did you used to get nervous, Aubrey, for tests before you would take them in school?
Absolutely, yes.
I remember the most nervous I ever was.
transcript.translation: 有人告诉我他们之前上过这门课，说如果你对成绩满意，这个老师就不让你参加期末考试。

transcript.text: Someone told me they had taken the class before and they said, if you're confident with your grade, this teacher doesn't make you take the final.
He says, go you.
transcript.translation: 你知道的，你不需要参加。

transcript.text: You know you, you don't have to take it.
transcript.translation: 所以我完全没复习，最后一天去了。

transcript.text: So I didn't study at all and I went the last day.
transcript.translation: 但我想，万一那个学生说错了呢？

transcript.text: But I was like, what if that student was wrong?
transcript.translation: 结果发现我必须参加期末考试。

transcript.text: And I find out I have to take the final.
transcript.translation: 我完全没复习，但他说的是对的。

transcript.text: I hadn't studied at all, but then he was right.
transcript.translation: 他说，如果你满意你的成绩。

transcript.text: He was like, if you're happy, thank your grade.
You don't have to take it.
I saved all that time.
I was so happy.
Oh my gosh.
Rumors, right?
Good thing.
It was true.
Good thing it was true.
I know, right?
'cause I, I risked it there.
It was kind of a gamble.
It was risky.
Yeah.
Gamble.
All right.
What did you say next?
Aubrey?
transcript.translation: 好的，然后你问我的论文写什么主题，我...让我看看，你说那绝对是你想深入了解的话题。

transcript.text: All right, so then you were asking what I'm writing my thesis on and I, let's see, you said that's definitely something I'd like to read up on.
transcript.translation: 所以，哦，在那之前我说我一直在研究性别如何影响人的自我认知。

transcript.text: So, oh, the before that you said I've, I said I've been studying up on how much one's gender affects their sense of self.
So this is interesting.
It is.
There is a little bit of a nuance here.
Yeah.
transcript.translation: 这暗示我确实在做研究。

transcript.text: This imp applies that I am really researching.
transcript.translation: 我在学习，我在看研究，可能是案例研究。

transcript.text: I'm studying, I'm looking at studies, case studies maybe.
Right.
transcript.translation: 我更深入地研究材料来理解某些东西，而不仅仅是阅读文章。

transcript.text: I'm diving into the material more to understand something rather than just reading articles for example.
Yeah.
transcript.translation: 有点像你写论文时，比如写硕士论文或博士论文，你会做文献综述，对吧。

transcript.text: It's kind of like when you write a paper, like you write a master's thesis or a PhD, you do a literature review, right.
transcript.translation: 你必须完成整个回顾已有文献的过程。

transcript.text: You have to do that whole process where you review what's already been written.
transcript.translation: 这就是使用'study up on'的语境。

transcript.text: That would be a context to use setting up on.
Exactly.
Right.
Right.
transcript.translation: 你甚至可能在做研究、调查，通过这种方式获取信息。

transcript.text: You might even be creating studies, surveys and having to get input that way.
Right.
transcript.translation: 而'read up on'是你接下来用的表达。

transcript.text: Whereas read up on is what you said next.
transcript.translation: 那更多意味着，我想多读一些关于那个的内容。

transcript.text: And that would just mean more like, I would like to read a lot about that.
You said.
transcript.translation: 那绝对是我想要深入了解的话题。

transcript.text: That's definitely something I'd like to read up on.
All right.
Excellent.
transcript.translation: Aubrey，今天的节目我们应该在哪里结束？

transcript.text: Aubrey, where should we leave our listeners for today's episode?
I like this theme.
transcript.translation: 这些词汇的主题，因为它是关于随时了解新事物。

transcript.text: The theme of these words because it's about staying up to date on things.
transcript.translation: 在某种意义上，这是关于终身学习，不是吗？

transcript.text: It's about lifelong learning in a sense, isn't it?
Yes, absolutely.
We should all be lifelong learners.
Right?
transcript.translation: 我知道你们对世界充满好奇。

transcript.text: I know you guys are curious about the world.
transcript.translation: 肯定有你们正在研究或深入了解的东西。

transcript.text: There's certainly something you are studying up on, reading up on.
transcript.translation: 我也很高兴，真的很感谢这个问题，因为你能明白这为什么会让人困惑。

transcript.text: And I'm also glad to be that really grateful for this question because you could see how this would be confusing.
transcript.translation: 你可能会不小心问同事是否在'埋头苦读'，而你知道他们需要为一个项目阅读很多资料。

transcript.text: You might accidentally ask someone at work if they're hitting the books when you know they're, they need to read a lot for a project.
transcript.translation: 所以知道这个表达特指你在学校注册的学习是很好的。

transcript.text: So it's good to know that that's very specific to studies schooling that you would be enrolled in.
Yeah.
transcript.translation: 但记住，如果你是个专业人士，在上夜校，你也可以用'埋头苦读'，对吧？

transcript.text: But keep in mind, if you're a professional and you're in like night school, you could hit the books, right?
Absolutely.
That's the other piece.
transcript.translation: 只要你注册了正式的学术课程，这就是'hit the books'的区别，我认为Aubrey。

transcript.text: As long as you're enrolled in a formal academic endeavor, that's the difference with hit the books I think Aubrey.
Yeah.
Yes, exactly.
transcript.translation: 然后对于其他所有情况，你可以用'study up on'。

transcript.text: And then for everything else, you can study up on it.
transcript.translation: 我们正在继续阅读相关内容，是的。

transcript.text: We're reading up on it as we continue to, yeah.

keyword.explanation: 指持续一生都在学习新知识和技能的人，强调学习不受年龄或教育阶段限制

usages.en: In today's fast-changing world, we should all strive to be lifelong learners.
usages.zh: 在当今快速变化的世界里，我们都应该努力成为终身学习者

transcript.text: Be lifelong learners.

keyword.explanation: 口语表达，表示同意/确认对方说对了，或表示会按要求完成某事

usages.en: "Can you send me the report by 5pm?" "You got it!"
usages.zh: "你能在下午5点前发报告给我吗？" "没问题！"

transcript.text: You got it.

keyword.explanation: 口语赞美用语，表示对内容/表现的肯定，类似中文的"不错/很棒"

usages.en: Your presentation was really good stuff!

transcript.text: Alright, good stuff guys.
transcript.translation: 如果想成为终身学习者，就点击订阅按钮。

keyword.explanation: 网络用语，此处指点击订阅按钮（fall button可能是follow button的口误或特定平台术语）

usages.en: Hit the subscribe button to get notifications.
usages.zh: 点击订阅按钮获取通知

transcript.text: Hit the fall button if you wanna be a lifelong learner.
transcript.translation: 和我们一起，就在这里，All Ears English。

transcript.text: With us, with All Ears English right here.
And Aubrey, I'll see you back here very soon.
All right.
Awesome.
See you next time.
Good stuff.
Bye.
Bye.
